content.description:
A couple of strong moves gets you to the 1st bolt. The crux is getting to the 2nd bolt. Either do a tough mantle, or stem to the right and use some small holds to stand up on a sloping ledge. Staying right of the bolt line, find some hidden holds and small feet to clip the third. Pull over the bulge to easier terrain to the chains.

For top-rope climbing, scramble up the short 5th class section around to the right.
content.location:
Walk 100 yards up the canyon trail from

Two O'Clock Rock

. The climb is found in a shady grove of pine trees.

content.description: Easy climbing on big holds. A short beginner route or TR for kids.
content.location:
This is the second climb at the mouth of the canyon (east side), between

Half Pint

and

The Flopper

. From the

Membrane

pull-out, cross the road and scramble up a steep bank to a flat shaded area.

content.description: A low angle easy start gives way to steeper climbing for a few moves, then an easy finish to the chains.
content.location:
This is the third climb at the mouth of the canyon (east side), just left of

Small Fry

. From the

Membrane

pull-out, cross the road and scramble up a steep bank to a flat shaded area.

content.description: A beginner route.  Climb on big holds.  The moves by the second bolt are fun.
content.location: This is the route to the right of Small Fry.

content.description: A fairly casual line that starts up broken, lower-angled rock, then steepens a bit and provides positive edges. A semi-detached flake appears just left of the bolt line midway through the climb and holds provided by the flake keep the climbing easy.
content.protection: 6 closely spaced bolts, ring anchors. The first bolt is out-of-line (to the left) with the rest and not particularly useful.
content.location:
Follow the trail on the east of the streambed up the canyon. After crossing the streambed the trail turns right and heads among a number of large evergreen trees.

This route will appear on the right side of a west-facing wall directly in front of you.
